faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Everything parents and students want to know

q1.question: Is there any registration or enrollment fee for the scholarship?
q1.answer: Absolutely! This program is designed specifically for students with no prior coding experience. We start from the very basics and build up gradually. Our instructors are trained to work with young learners and make coding fun and accessible.

q2.question: Who is eligible to apply for the scholarship?
q2.answer: The scholarship is available to primary school students according to the grades and eligibility criteria specified by the initiative.

q3.question: Is the scholarship available in all governorates?
q3.answer: Yes, there is a friendly final exam at the end of each term. The exams are designed to be fun and encourage learning, not stress. They help students demonstrate what they've learned and build confidence in their coding skills.

q4.question: What is the annual study duration of the scholarship?
q4.answer: Yes! Upon successfully completing the program and passing the final exams, students receive an official certificate from the Ministry of Communications and 3C Coding School. This certificate recognizes their achievement and coding skills.

q5.question: What are the communication channels with the initiative's specialists?
q5.answer: Parents are welcome to observe online sessions! We encourage parental involvement, especially for younger students. This helps parents understand what their children are learning and support them at home.
